trans-unit.source: Allows security actions for <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission"></xref> to be applied to code using declarative security.
<xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute> controls the ability for audio, image, and video media to work in a partial-trust Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) application.
The scope of the declaration that is allowed depends on the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction> that is used.
The security information declared by a security attribute is stored in the metadata of the attribute target and is accessed by the system at run time.
Security attributes are used only for declarative security.
For imperative security, use the corresponding permission class, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission>.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute"></xref>.

The default media values are <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio.AllAudio>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage.NoImage>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo.NoVideo>.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the audio permission level for the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute"></xref>.
The default is <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio.SafeAudio>.
The state of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAudio"></xref>.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission"></xref>.
This method should only be called by the security system, never by application code.
At compile time, attributes convert security declarations to a serialized form in metadata.
Declarative security data in metadata is created from the permission that this method returns that corresponds to this attribute.
A <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermission"></xref> that corresponds to this attribute.
Gets or sets the image permission level for the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute"></xref>.
The default is <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage.SafeImage>.
The state of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionImage"></xref>.
Gets or sets the video permission level for the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionAttribute"></xref>.
The default is <xref:System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo.SafeVideo>.
The state of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.MediaPermissionVideo"></xref>.
